prompt: <description>**Instructions for Creating the CAD Model** **Part 1: Creating the Base of the Cylindrical Object** Construct the base of the cylindrical object. Begin by creating a new coordinate system at the origin of the CAD model with euler angles [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and translation vector [0.0, 0.1765, 0.0]. 1.1. Create a new sketch on face 1 of the coordinate system. a. Draw a circle with center at [0.0221, 0.375] and radius 0.0221. 1.2. Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.75. 1.3. Extrude the sketch in the direction of the normal by a depth of 0.1765. The resulting shape should be a cylindrical object with a smaller cylindrical hole in the center, positioned horizontally. The object is located in the upper right corner of the image. The dimensions of the part are length: 0.75, width: 0.1765, and height: 0.75. **Part 2: Creating the Lid of the Cylindrical Object** Construct the lid of the cylindrical object. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the same properties as part 1's coordinate system. 2.1. Create a new sketch on face 1 of the coordinate system. a. Draw a circle with center at [0.0221, 0.375] and radius 0.0221. b. Draw a circle with center at [0.2868, 0.0221] and radius 0.0221. c. Draw a circle with center at [0.2868, 0.7279] and radius 0.0221. 2.2. Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.75. 2.3. Extrude the sketch in the direction of the normal by a depth of 0.1765. The resulting shape should be a cylindrical object with a flat top and bottom, positioned at the center of a larger cylinder. The smaller cylinder is slightly offset from the center of the larger cylinder. The dimensions of the part are length: 0.75, width: 0.1765, and height: 0.75. The final CAD model should be a cylindrical object with a smaller cylindrical hole in the center, positioned on a flat surface. The lid of the cylindrical object should fit perfectly on top of the base, forming a single solid body.</description>
